name: Dynamic URL
author: Coder Pile

sections.description:
Picture this: You are running different marketing campaigns to attract users. Depending on which campaign a user comes from, the url/href needs to be different. This is where the simple yet powerful Dynamic URL plugin comes in handy.

With this plugin, you can create shortcodes that automatically detect the UTM campaign from the browser URL and direct users to the appropriate destination URL.

This plugin will provide a more intuitive and customized experience for your website visitors, and help you optimize your website for better conversion rates. It also has a note feature so you can keep track of all your links.

Basic usage

  • Download and activate the plugin from the WordPress directory.
  • Once it is activated, you can start using the plugin without even adding the campaign details. The shortcode format is: [dynamicURL default_url=”http://yourwebsite.com” title=”My Link Text” target=”_blank” class=”custom-button”]
  • To add campaign and URL details, click on the Dynamic URL on the sidebar or Settings on the plugin listings page.
  • You should now see the Dynamic URL settings page where you can add campaigns and url details.

See additional details and demo here.

short_description: This plugin generates dynamic URLs based on utm_campaigns value.
